drugRef.pageSubtitle: Search US FDA drug label information via OpenFDA.
drugRef.importantDisclaimerText:
This tool provides information primarily sourced from OpenFDA (US FDA). Where official data is unavailable for certain fields, **Artificial Intelligence (AI) may be used to supplement the information.**

All information, whether from official sources or AI, is for **informational and educational purposes ONLY.** It may not be complete, fully up-to-date, or applicable outside the US. **AI-generated content requires extra scrutiny and verification.**

This tool **DOES NOT substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.** Always consult your doctor or pharmacist regarding medications and health concerns. Never disregard professional medical advice or delay seeking it because of something you have read here.
drugRef.searchCardDescription: Enter a drug name (generic or brand)
drugRef.noResultsFound: No results found for the search term.
drugRef.promptSearch: Enter a drug name above and click Search.
drugRef.accessDeniedLevel: Access denied for your current subscription level.
drugRef.failedToCheckAccess: Failed to check feature access. Please try again.

drugRef.errorFetchingData: An error occurred while fetching data. Please check your network connection and try again later.

medicalCalculatorPage.pageSubtitle: Calculate common clinical values. For informational purposes only.

accessDenied.title: Access Denied
accessDenied.defaultMessage: You do not have permission to access this feature.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.text: This calculator is intended for informational and educational purposes only and does not substitute for professional medical diagnosis, advice, or treatment. Normal values can vary. Always consult with a qualified healthcare professional for accurate interpretation and recommendations.

error.title: Error
error.bmiInputs: BMI: Please enter valid positive numbers for weight (kg) and height (cm).
error.bsaInputs: BSA: Please enter valid positive numbers for weight (kg) and height (cm).
error.egfrInputs: eGFR: Please enter valid positive numbers for creatinine (mg/dL), age, and select sex.
error.ibwInputs: IBW: Please enter a valid positive height (cm) and select sex.
error.adjbwActualWeightInput: AdjBW: Please enter a valid positive Actual Body Weight (kg).
error.adjbwIbwRequired: AdjBW: Please calculate Ideal Body Weight (IBW) first.
error.bmrInputs: BMR: Please enter valid positive numbers for weight (kg), height (cm), age, and select sex.
error.correctedCaInputs: Corrected Ca: Please enter valid positive numbers for Total Calcium (mg/dL) and Albumin (g/dL).

interpretation.typical: BSA is often used by clinicians for drug dosing or physiological assessments. Typical adult values range from 1.5 to 2.2 m².

interpretation.stage1_desc: Normal or high kidney function (check for kidney damage if other signs present).
interpretation.stage3a_desc: Mild to moderately decreased kidney function.
interpretation.stage3b_desc: Moderate to severely decreased kidney function.

interpretation.devine: This is an estimation using the Devine formula. IBW is often used for ventilator settings or certain drug dosages.

interpretation.notTypicallyCalculated: Adjusted Body Weight is typically calculated when Actual Body Weight significantly exceeds Ideal Body Weight (e.g., >120%).
interpretation.purpose: AdjBW estimates a relevant body mass for dosing certain drugs in obese patients. It's used when Actual Weight significantly exceeds Ideal Weight.

interpretation.definition: This is the estimated minimum calories your body needs at rest. Total daily energy needs depend on activity levels.

interpretation.prefix: Corrected for Albumin ({{albumin}} g/dL). This estimates calcium if albumin were normal (4.0 g/dL).
interpretation.belowRange: Result is below the typical normal range (approx. 8.5-10.5 mg/dL).
interpretation.aboveRange: Result is above the typical normal range (approx. 8.5-10.5 mg/dL).
interpretation.withinRange: Result is within the typical normal range (approx. 8.5-10.5 mg/dL).

header.title: Disease Information Search
header.subtitle: Search for disease information on Mayo Clinic and MedlinePlus.

disclaimer.title: IMPORTANT DISCLAIMER:
disclaimer.text: This tool provides links to external search results on authoritative sources (Mayo Clinic, MedlinePlus) for general informational purposes ONLY. It DOES NOT constitute medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment recommendation. Always consult with a qualified healthcare professional for any health concerns or before making any decisions related to your health or treatment.

results.detailedInfoDisclaimer: Disclaimer: This detailed information was generated by AI and is for informational purposes only. Always consult the original sources and a healthcare professional.

header.title: Clinical Scoring Hub
header.subtitle: A collection of validated clinical scoring calculators for risk stratification, diagnosis, severity assessment, and prognosis.

accessDenied.title: Access Denied
accessDenied.defaultMessage: You do not have permission to access this feature.
accessDenied.couldNotVerify: Could not verify feature access at this time.

cardiologyScores.title: Cardiology Scores
cardiologyScores.description: Calculators related to cardiovascular risk and conditions.

pulmonologyScores.title: Pulmonology/Critical Care Scores
pulmonologyScores.description: Calculators for respiratory conditions and critical illness.

gastroenterologyScores.title: Gastroenterology Scores
gastroenterologyScores.description: Calculators relevant to liver and digestive diseases.

chadsvascScore.title: CHA₂DS₂-VASc Score Calculator
chadsvascScore.description: For Stroke Risk Stratification in Atrial Fibrillation

criteria.congestiveHeartFailure: Congestive Heart Failure / LV Dysfunction (1 pt)
criteria.vascularDisease: Vascular Disease (Prior MI, PAD, Aortic Plaque) (1 pt)

interpretation.female_score_gte_2: Score {{score}} (Female): Anticoagulation recommended (Risk increases with score)
interpretation.female_score_0: Score 0 (Female): Low risk, anticoagulation generally not recommended (Risk ~1.1%/year)
interpretation.male_score_0: Score 0 (Male): Low risk, anticoagulation generally not recommended (Risk ~0.8%/year)
interpretation.male_score_gte_1: Score {{score}} (Male): Anticoagulation recommended (Risk increases with score)

chadsvascScore.disclaimerText: This tool is for educational purposes only and does not replace clinical judgment. Consult current guidelines.

wellsScoreDvt.title: Wells' Score Calculator for DVT
wellsScoreDvt.description: For Deep Vein Thrombosis Probability Assessment

criteria.activeCancer: Active cancer (treatment within 6 months, or palliative) (+1 pt)
criteria.paralysisParesisImmobilization: Paralysis, paresis, or recent plaster immobilization of lower extremity (+1 pt)
criteria.bedriddenRecently: Recently bedridden >3 days or major surgery within 12 weeks requiring general/regional anesthesia (+1 pt)
criteria.localizedTenderness: Localized tenderness along the distribution of the deep venous system (+1 pt)
criteria.calfSwellingDifference: Calf swelling >3 cm compared to asymptomatic leg (measured 10 cm below tibial tuberosity) (+1 pt)
criteria.pittingEdema: Pitting edema (confined to symptomatic leg) (+1 pt)
criteria.alternativeDiagnosisLikely: Alternative diagnosis at least as likely as DVT (-2 pts)

wellsScoreDvt.disclaimerText: This tool is for educational purposes only and does not replace clinical judgment or diagnostic testing (e.g., D-dimer, ultrasound). Consult current guidelines.

wellsScorePe.title: Wells' Score Calculator for PE

criteria.clinicalSignsDvt: Clinical signs and symptoms of DVT (minimum of leg swelling and pain with palpation of the deep veins) (+3 pts)
criteria.peMostLikelyDiagnosis: PE is #1 diagnosis OR equally likely (+3 pts)
criteria.immobilizationOrSurgery: Immobilization at least 3 days OR surgery in the previous 4 weeks (+1.5 pts)
criteria.previousPeOrDvt: Previous, objectively diagnosed PE or DVT (+1.5 pts)
criteria.malignancy: Malignancy with treatment within 6 months or palliative (+1 pt)

wellsScorePe.disclaimerText: This tool aids in risk stratification but does not replace clinical judgment or diagnostic testing (e.g., D-dimer, CTPA). Consult current guidelines.

gcsScore.title: Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) Calculator
gcsScore.description: Assesses level of consciousness after head injury.

interpretation.selectOptionsPrompt: Select one option from each category (Eyes, Verbal, Motor) to calculate the score.

gcsScore.disclaimerText: This tool is for educational purposes. GCS assessment requires clinical training. Consider factors like intubation (V score = VT) or sedation.

curb65Score.title: CURB-65 Score Calculator

criteria.confusion: Confusion (new disorientation in person, place, or time) (+1 pt)
criteria.lowBloodPressure: Low Blood Pressure (SBP < 90 mmHg or DBP ≤ 60 mmHg) (+1 pt)

interpretation.low_risk: Score {{score}}: Low risk (Mortality ~1.5%). Consider outpatient treatment.
interpretation.moderate_risk: Score {{score}}: Moderate risk (Mortality ~9.2%). Consider hospital admission.
interpretation.high_risk: Score {{score}}: High risk (Mortality ~22%). Urgent hospital admission, consider ICU.

curb65Score.disclaimerText: This tool aids severity assessment and site-of-care decisions but does not replace clinical judgment. Consider other factors (e.g., comorbidities, oxygen saturation).

meldScore.title: MELD / MELD-Na Score Calculator
meldScore.description: Model for End-Stage Liver Disease Prognosis

labels.dialysis: Dialysis twice within the past 7 days?

interpretation.prompt: Enter Bilirubin, Creatinine, and INR values.
interpretation.result_format: MELD Score: {{meldScore}} ({{risk}}).{{naInterpretation}} Used for liver transplant allocation and prognostication.

meldScore.disclaimerText: This tool is for educational purposes. MELD score calculation follows specific UNOS/OPTN rules. Consult official guidelines for clinical use, especially regarding transplant allocation.

authRequired.description: Please <1>Sign In</1> or <3>Sign Up</3> to use this feature.
